AccessKey.description:
Access key provides limited access to an account. Each access key belongs to some account and
is identified by a unique (within the account) public key. One account may have large number of
access keys. Access keys allow to act on behalf of the account by restricting transactions
that can be issued.
`account_id,public_key` is a key in the state

nonce.description:
Nonce for this access key, used for tx nonce generation. When access key is created, nonce
is set to `(block_height - 1) * 1e6` to avoid tx hash collision on access key re-creation.
See <https://github.com/near/nearcore/issues/3779> for more details.

permission.description: Defines permissions for this access key.

AccessKey.title: AccessKey

AccessKeyCreationConfigView.description: Describes the cost of creating an access key.

full_access_cost.description: Base cost of creating a full access access-key.

function_call_cost.description: Base cost of creating an access-key restricted to specific functions.

function_call_cost_per_byte.description: Cost per byte of method_names of creating a restricted access-key.

AccessKeyCreationConfigView.title: AccessKeyCreationConfigView

AccessKeyInfoView.description: Describes information about an access key including the public key.
AccessKeyInfoView.title: AccessKeyInfoView

oneOf.description:
Grants full access to the account.
NOTE: It's used to replace account-level public keys.

Gas key with limited permission to make transactions with FunctionCallActions
Gas keys are a kind of access keys with a prepaid balance to pay for gas.
oneOf.title: GasKeyFunctionCall

oneOf.description:
Gas key with full access to the account.
Gas keys are a kind of access keys with a prepaid balance to pay for gas.
oneOf.title: GasKeyFullAccess

AccessKeyPermissionView.description: Describes the permission scope for an access key. Whether it is a function call or a full access key.
AccessKeyPermissionView.title: AccessKeyPermissionView

AccessKeyView.description: Describes access key permission scope and nonce.
AccessKeyView.title: AccessKeyView

AccountCreationConfigView.description: The structure describes configuration for creation of new accounts.

min_allowed_top_level_account_length.description: The minimum length of the top-level account ID that is allowed to be created by any account.

registrar_account_id.description:
The account ID of the account registrar. This account ID allowed to create top-level
accounts of any valid length.

AccountCreationConfigView.title: AccountCreationConfigView

AccountDataView.description:
AccountData is a piece of global state that a validator
signs and broadcasts to the network.

It is essentially the data that a validator wants to share with the network.
All the nodes in the network are collecting the account data
broadcasted by the validators.
Since the number of the validators is bounded and their
identity is known (and the maximal size of allowed AccountData is bounded)
the global state that is distributed in the form of AccountData is bounded
as well.
Find more information in the docs [here](https://github.com/near/nearcore/blob/560f7fc8f4b3106e0d5d46050688610b1f104ac6/chain/client/src/client.rs#L2232)

account_key.description: Account key of the validator signing this AccountData.

peer_id.description: ID of the node that handles the account key (aka validator key).

proxies.description:
Proxy nodes that are directly connected to the validator node
(this list may include the validator node itself).
TIER1 nodes should connect to one of the proxies to sent TIER1
messages to the validator.

timestamp.description: UTC timestamp of when the AccountData has been signed.

AccountDataView.title: AccountDataView

AccountId.description:
NEAR Account Identifier.

This is a unique, syntactically valid, human-readable account identifier on the NEAR network.

[See the crate-level docs for information about validation.](index.html#account-id-rules)

Also see [Error kind precedence](AccountId#error-kind-precedence).

## Examples

```
use near_account_id::AccountId;

let alice: AccountId = "alice.near".parse().unwrap();

assert!("ƒelicia.near".parse::<AccountId>().is_err()); // (ƒ is not f)
```
AccountId.title: AccountId

AccountWithPublicKey.description: Account ID with its public key.
AccountWithPublicKey.title: AccountWithPublicKey

ActionCreationConfigView.description: Describes the cost of creating a specific action, `Action`. Includes all variants.

add_key_cost.description: Base cost of adding a key.

create_account_cost.description: Base cost of creating an account.

delegate_cost.description:
Base cost for processing a delegate action.

This is on top of the costs for the actions inside the delegate action.

delete_account_cost.description: Base cost of deleting an account.

delete_key_cost.description: Base cost of deleting a key.

deploy_contract_cost.description: Base cost of deploying a contract.

deploy_contract_cost_per_byte.description: Cost per byte of deploying a contract.

function_call_cost.description: Base cost of calling a function.

function_call_cost_per_byte.description: Cost per byte of method name and arguments of calling a function.

transfer_cost.description: Base cost of making a transfer.

ActionCreationConfigView.title: ActionCreationConfigView

ActionError.description: An error happened during Action execution

index.description:
Index of the failed action in the transaction.
Action index is not defined if ActionError.kind is `ActionErrorKind::LackBalanceForState`

ActionError.title: ActionError

oneOf.description: Happens when CreateAccount action tries to create an account with account_id which is already exists in the storage
oneOf.title: AccountAlreadyExists

oneOf.description: Happens when TX receiver_id doesn't exist (but action is not Action::CreateAccount)
oneOf.title: AccountDoesNotExist

oneOf.description: A top-level account ID can only be created by registrar.
oneOf.title: CreateAccountOnlyByRegistrar

oneOf.description: A newly created account must be under a namespace of the creator account
oneOf.title: CreateAccountNotAllowed

oneOf.description:
Administrative actions like `DeployContract`, `Stake`, `AddKey`, `DeleteKey`. can be proceed only if sender=receiver
or the first TX action is a `CreateAccount` action
oneOf.title: ActorNoPermission

oneOf.description: Account tries to remove an access key that doesn't exist
oneOf.title: DeleteKeyDoesNotExist

oneOf.description: The public key is already used for an existing access key
oneOf.title: AddKeyAlreadyExists

oneOf.description: Account is staking and can not be deleted
oneOf.title: DeleteAccountStaking

oneOf.description: ActionReceipt can't be completed, because the remaining balance will not be enough to cover storage.

amount.description: Balance required to complete an action.

oneOf.title: LackBalanceForState

oneOf.description: Account is not yet staked, but tries to unstake
oneOf.title: TriesToUnstake

oneOf.description: The account doesn't have enough balance to increase the stake.
oneOf.title: TriesToStake

oneOf.description: An error occurred during a `FunctionCall` Action, parameter is debug message.
oneOf.title: FunctionCallError

oneOf.description:
Error occurs when a new `ActionReceipt` created by the `FunctionCall` action fails
receipt validation.
oneOf.title: NewReceiptValidationError

oneOf.description:
Error occurs when a `CreateAccount` action is called on a NEAR-implicit or ETH-implicit account.
See NEAR-implicit account creation NEP: <https://github.com/nearprotocol/NEPs/pull/71>.
Also, see ETH-implicit account creation NEP: <https://github.com/near/NEPs/issues/518>.

TODO(#8598): This error is named very poorly. A better name would be
`OnlyNamedAccountCreationAllowed`.
oneOf.title: OnlyImplicitAccountCreationAllowed

oneOf.description: Delete account whose state is large is temporarily banned.
oneOf.title: DeleteAccountWithLargeState

oneOf.description: Signature does not match the provided actions and given signer public key.
Receiver of the transaction doesn't match Sender of the delegate action
oneOf.title: DelegateActionSenderDoesNotMatchTxReceiver

oneOf.description: Delegate action has expired. `max_block_height` is less than actual block height.
The given public key doesn't exist for Sender account
oneOf.title: DelegateActionAccessKeyError

oneOf.description: DelegateAction nonce must be greater sender[public_key].nonce
oneOf.title: DelegateActionInvalidNonce

oneOf.description: DelegateAction nonce is larger than the upper bound given by the block height
oneOf.title: DelegateActionNonceTooLarge

oneOf.description: Gas key does not exist for the specified public key
oneOf.title: GasKeyDoesNotExist

oneOf.description: Gas key does not have sufficient balance for the requested withdrawal
oneOf.title: InsufficientGasKeyBalance

ActionsValidationError.description: Describes the error for validating a list of actions.

oneOf.description: The delete action must be a final action in transaction
The total prepaid gas (for all given actions) exceeded the limit.
oneOf.title: TotalPrepaidGasExceeded

oneOf.description: The number of actions exceeded the given limit.
oneOf.title: TotalNumberOfActionsExceeded

oneOf.description: The total number of bytes of the method names exceeded the limit in a Add Key action.
oneOf.title: AddKeyMethodNamesNumberOfBytesExceeded

oneOf.description: The length of some method name exceeded the limit in a Add Key action.
oneOf.title: AddKeyMethodNameLengthExceeded

oneOf.description: Integer overflow during a compute.
Invalid account ID.
oneOf.title: InvalidAccountId

oneOf.description: The size of the contract code exceeded the limit in a DeployContract action.
oneOf.title: ContractSizeExceeded

oneOf.description: The length of the method name exceeded the limit in a Function Call action.
oneOf.title: FunctionCallMethodNameLengthExceeded

oneOf.description: The length of the arguments exceeded the limit in a Function Call action.
oneOf.title: FunctionCallArgumentsLengthExceeded

oneOf.description: An attempt to stake with a public key that is not convertible to ristretto.
oneOf.title: UnsuitableStakingKey

oneOf.description: The attached amount of gas in a FunctionCall action has to be a positive number.
There should be the only one DelegateAction

The transaction includes a feature that the current protocol version
does not support.

Note: we stringify the protocol feature name instead of using
`ProtocolFeature` here because we don't want to leak the internals of
that type into observable borsh serialization.
oneOf.title: UnsupportedProtocolFeature

oneOf.description: Gas keys with FunctionCall permission cannot have an allowance set.

ActionsValidationError.title: ActionsValidationError

AddKeyAction.description: An action that adds key with public key associated

access_key.description: An access key with the permission

public_key.description: A public key which will be associated with an access_key

AddKeyAction.title: AddKeyAction

BandwidthRequest.description:
`BandwidthRequest` describes the size of receipts that a shard would like to send to another shard.
When a shard wants to send a lot of receipts to another shard, it needs to create a request and wait
for a bandwidth grant from the bandwidth scheduler.

requested_values_bitmap.description: Bitmap which describes what values of bandwidth are requested.

BandwidthRequest.title: BandwidthRequest

BandwidthRequestBitmap.description:
Bitmap which describes which values from the predefined list are being requested.
The nth bit is set to 1 when the nth value from the list is being requested.
BandwidthRequestBitmap.title: BandwidthRequestBitmap

BandwidthRequests.description:
A list of shard's bandwidth requests.
Describes how much the shard would like to send to other shards.
BandwidthRequests.title: BandwidthRequests

BlockHeaderInnerLiteView.description: A part of a state for the current head of a light client. More info [here](https://nomicon.io/ChainSpec/LightClient).

block_merkle_root.description: The merkle root of all the block hashes

epoch_id.description: The epoch to which the block that is the current known head belongs

next_bp_hash.description: The hash of the block producers set for the next epoch

next_epoch_id.description: The epoch that will follow the current epoch

timestamp.description: Legacy json number. Should not be used.

BlockHeaderInnerLiteView.title: BlockHeaderInnerLiteView

BlockHeaderView.description: Contains main info about the block.

prev_hash.description: The hash of the previous Block

timestamp.description: Legacy json number. Should not be used.

BlockHeaderView.title: BlockHeaderView

BlockStatusView.description: Height and hash of a block
BlockStatusView.title: BlockStatusView

CallResult.description: A result returned by contract method
CallResult.title: CallResult

ChunkDistributionNetworkConfig.description:
Config for the Chunk Distribution Network feature.
This allows nodes to push and pull chunks from a central stream.
The two benefits of this approach are: (1) less request/response traffic
on the peer-to-peer network and (2) lower latency for RPC nodes indexing the chain.
ChunkDistributionNetworkConfig.title: ChunkDistributionNetworkConfig

ChunkDistributionUris.description: URIs for the Chunk Distribution Network feature.

get.description: URI for pulling chunks from the stream.

set.description: URI for publishing chunks to the stream.

ChunkDistributionUris.title: ChunkDistributionUris

ChunkHeaderView.description: Contains main info about the chunk.

proposed_split.description:
Proposed trie split for dynamic resharding
`None`: field missing (`ChunkHeaderInnerV4` or earlier)
`Some(None)`: field present, but not set (`ChunkHeaderInnerV5` or later)
`Some(Some(split))`: field present and set

ChunkHeaderView.title: ChunkHeaderView

CloudArchivalWriterConfig.description:
Configuration for a cloud-based archival writer. If this config is present, the writer is enabled and
writes chunk-related data based on the tracked shards. This config also controls additional archival
behavior such as block data and polling interval.

archive_block_data.description: Determines whether block-related data should be written to cloud storage.

polling_interval.description: Interval at which the system checks for new blocks or chunks to archive.

CloudArchivalWriterConfig.title: CloudArchivalWriterConfig

oneOf.description:
This is for defense in depth.
We expect our runtime-independent preparation code to fully catch all invalid wasms,
but, if it ever misses something we’ll emit this error
oneOf.title: WasmerCompileError

CongestionControlConfigView.description: The configuration for congestion control. More info about congestion [here](https://near.github.io/nearcore/architecture/how/receipt-congestion.html?highlight=congestion#receipt-congestion)

allowed_shard_outgoing_gas.description:
How much gas the chosen allowed shard can send to a 100% congested shard.

See [`CongestionControlConfig`] for more details.

max_congestion_incoming_gas.description:
How much gas in delayed receipts of a shard is 100% incoming congestion.

See [`CongestionControlConfig`] for more details.

max_congestion_memory_consumption.description:
How much memory space of all delayed and buffered receipts in a shard is
considered 100% congested.

See [`CongestionControlConfig`] for more details.

max_congestion_missed_chunks.description: How many missed chunks in a row in a shard is considered 100% congested.

max_congestion_outgoing_gas.description:
How much gas in outgoing buffered receipts of a shard is 100% congested.

Outgoing congestion contributes to overall congestion, which reduces how
much other shards are allowed to forward to this shard.

max_outgoing_gas.description:
The maximum amount of gas attached to receipts a shard can forward to
another shard per chunk.

See [`CongestionControlConfig`] for more details.

max_tx_gas.description:
The maximum amount of gas in a chunk spent on converting new transactions to
receipts.

See [`CongestionControlConfig`] for more details.

min_outgoing_gas.description:
The minimum gas each shard can send to a shard that is not fully congested.

See [`CongestionControlConfig`] for more details.

min_tx_gas.description:
The minimum amount of gas in a chunk spent on converting new transactions
to receipts, as long as the receiving shard is not congested.

See [`CongestionControlConfig`] for more details.

outgoing_receipts_big_size_limit.description:
Large size limit for outgoing receipts to a shard, used when it's safe
to send a lot of receipts without making the state witness too large.
It limits the total sum of outgoing receipts, not individual receipts.

outgoing_receipts_usual_size_limit.description:
The standard size limit for outgoing receipts aimed at a single shard.
This limit is pretty small to keep the size of source_receipt_proofs under control.
It limits the total sum of outgoing receipts, not individual receipts.

reject_tx_congestion_threshold.description:
How much congestion a shard can tolerate before it stops all shards from
accepting new transactions with the receiver set to the congested shard.

CongestionControlConfigView.title: CongestionControlConfigView

CongestionInfoView.description: Stores the congestion level of a shard. More info about congestion [here](https://near.github.io/nearcore/architecture/how/receipt-congestion.html?highlight=congestion#receipt-congestion)
CongestionInfoView.title: CongestionInfoView

ContractCodeView.description: A view of the contract code.
ContractCodeView.title: ContractCodeView

CurrentEpochValidatorInfo.description: Describes information about the current epoch validator

num_expected_chunks_per_shard.description:
Number of chunks this validator was expected to produce in each shard.
Each entry in the array corresponds to the shard in the `shards_produced` array.

num_expected_endorsements_per_shard.description:
Number of chunks this validator was expected to validate and endorse in each shard.
Each entry in the array corresponds to the shard in the `shards_endorsed` array.

shards.description: Shards this validator is assigned to as chunk producer in the current epoch.

shards_endorsed.description: Shards this validator is assigned to as chunk validator in the current epoch.

CurrentEpochValidatorInfo.title: CurrentEpochValidatorInfo

DataReceiptCreationConfigView.description: The fees settings for a data receipt creation

base_cost.description:
Base cost of creating a data receipt.
Both `send` and `exec` costs are burned when a new receipt has input dependencies. The gas
is charged for each input dependency. The dependencies are specified when a receipt is
created using `promise_then` and `promise_batch_then`.
NOTE: Any receipt with output dependencies will produce data receipts. Even if it fails.
Even if the last action is not a function call (in case of success it will return empty
value).

cost_per_byte.description:
Additional cost per byte sent.
Both `send` and `exec` costs are burned when a function call finishes execution and returns
`N` bytes of data to every output dependency. For each output dependency the cost is
`(send(sir) + exec()) * N`.

DataReceiptCreationConfigView.title: DataReceiptCreationConfigView

DelegateAction.description: This action allows to execute the inner actions behalf of the defined sender.

actions.description:
List of actions to be executed.

With the meta transactions MVP defined in NEP-366, nested
DelegateActions are not allowed. A separate type is used to enforce it.

max_block_height.description: The maximal height of the block in the blockchain below which the given DelegateAction is valid.

nonce.description:
Nonce to ensure that the same delegate action is not sent twice by a
relayer and should match for given account's `public_key`.
After this action is processed it will increment.

public_key.description: Public key used to sign this delegated action.

DelegateAction.title: DelegateAction

public_key.description: A public key associated with the access_key to be deleted.

DepositCostFailureReason.description:
Reason why a gas key transaction failed at the deposit/account level.
In these cases, gas is still charged from the gas key.
DepositCostFailureReason.title: DepositCostFailureReason

DumpConfig.description: Configures how to dump state to external storage.

credentials_file.description: Location of a json file with credentials allowing access to the bucket.

iteration_delay.description:
How often to check if a new epoch has started.
Feel free to set to `None`, defaults are sensible.

location.description: Specifies where to write the obtained state parts.

restart_dump_for_shards.description:
Use in case a node that dumps state to the external storage
gets in trouble.

DumpConfig.title: DumpConfig

EpochId.description:
Epoch identifier -- wrapped hash, to make it easier to distinguish.
EpochId of epoch T is the hash of last block in T-2
EpochId of first two epochs is 0
EpochId.title: EpochId

epoch_sync_horizon.description:
This serves as two purposes: (1) the node will not epoch sync and instead resort to
header sync, if the genesis block is within this many blocks from the current block;
(2) the node will reject an epoch sync proof if the provided proof is for an epoch
that is more than this many blocks behind the current block.

timeout_for_epoch_sync.description:
Timeout for epoch sync requests. The node will continue retrying indefinitely even
if this timeout is exceeded.

executor_id.description:
The id of the account on which the execution happens. For transaction this is signer_id,
for receipt this is receiver_id.

gas_burnt.description: The amount of the gas burnt by the given transaction or receipt.

logs.description: Logs from this transaction or receipt.

receipt_ids.description: Receipt IDs generated by this transaction or receipt.

status.description: Execution status. Contains the result in case of successful execution.

tokens_burnt.description:
The amount of tokens burnt corresponding to the burnt gas amount.
This value doesn't always equal to the `gas_burnt` multiplied by the gas price, because
the prepaid gas price might be lower than the actual gas price and it creates a deficit.
`tokens_burnt` also contains the penalty subtracted from refunds, while
`gas_burnt` only contains the gas that we actually burn for the execution.

oneOf.description: The execution is pending or unknown.
The execution has failed.
oneOf.title: Failure

oneOf.description: The final action succeeded and returned some value or an empty vec encoded in base64.
oneOf.title: SuccessValue

oneOf.description:
The final action of the receipt returned a promise or the signed transaction was converted
to a receipt. Contains the receipt_id of the generated receipt.
oneOf.title: SuccessReceiptId

ExtCostsConfigView.description:
Typed view of ExtCostsConfig to preserve JSON output field names in protocol
config RPC output.

alt_bn128_pairing_check_element.description: Per element cost for pairing check

base.description: Base cost for calling a host function.

contract_loading_base.description: Base cost of loading a pre-compiled contract

contract_loading_bytes.description: Cost per byte of loading a pre-compiled contract

ed25519_verify_byte.description: Cost of getting ed25519 per byte

keccak256_byte.description: Cost of getting sha256 per byte

keccak512_byte.description: Cost of getting sha256 per byte

promise_and_per_promise.description: Cost for calling `promise_and` for each promise

read_cached_trie_node.description: Cost for reading trie node from memory

read_memory_base.description: Base cost for guest memory read

read_register_base.description: Base cost for reading from register

read_register_byte.description: Cost for reading byte from register

ripemd160_block.description: Cost of getting ripemd160 per message block

sha256_byte.description: Cost of getting sha256 per byte

storage_has_key_base.description: Storage trie check for key existence cost base

storage_has_key_byte.description: Storage trie check for key existence per key byte

storage_iter_create_from_byte.description: Create trie range iterator cost per byte of from key.

storage_iter_create_prefix_base.description: Create trie prefix iterator cost base

storage_iter_create_prefix_byte.description: Create trie prefix iterator cost per byte.

storage_iter_create_range_base.description: Create trie range iterator cost base

storage_iter_create_to_byte.description: Create trie range iterator cost per byte of to key.

storage_iter_next_base.description: Trie iterator per key base cost

storage_iter_next_key_byte.description: Trie iterator next key byte cost

storage_iter_next_value_byte.description: Trie iterator next key byte cost

storage_large_read_overhead_base.description: Storage trie read key overhead base cost, when doing large reads

storage_large_read_overhead_byte.description: Storage trie read key overhead  per-byte cost, when doing large reads

storage_read_base.description: Storage trie read key base cost

storage_read_key_byte.description: Storage trie read key per byte cost

storage_read_value_byte.description: Storage trie read value cost per byte cost

storage_remove_base.description: Remove key from trie base cost

storage_remove_key_byte.description: Remove key from trie per byte cost

storage_remove_ret_value_byte.description: Remove key from trie ret value byte cost

storage_write_base.description: Storage trie write key base cost

storage_write_evicted_byte.description: Storage trie write cost per byte of evicted value.

storage_write_key_byte.description: Storage trie write key per byte cost

storage_write_value_byte.description: Storage trie write value per byte cost

touching_trie_node.description: Cost per reading trie node from DB

utf16_decoding_base.description: Base cost of decoding utf16. It's used for `log_utf16`.

utf16_decoding_byte.description: Cost per byte of decoding utf16. It's used for `log_utf16`.

utf8_decoding_base.description: Base cost of decoding utf8. It's used for `log_utf8` and `panic_utf8`.

utf8_decoding_byte.description: Cost per byte of decoding utf8. It's used for `log_utf8` and `panic_utf8`.

write_memory_base.description: Base cost for guest memory write

write_memory_byte.description: Cost for guest memory write per byte

write_register_base.description: Base cost for writing into register

write_register_byte.description: Cost for writing byte into register

yield_create_base.description: Base cost for creating a yield promise.

yield_create_byte.description: Per byte cost of arguments and method name.

yield_resume_base.description: Base cost for resuming a yield receipt.

yield_resume_byte.description: Per byte cost of resume payload.

ExtCostsConfigView.title: ExtCostsConfigView

external_storage_fallback_threshold.description:
The number of attempts the node will make to obtain a part from peers in
the network before it fetches from external storage.

num_concurrent_requests.description:
When fetching state parts from external storage, throttle fetch requests
to this many concurrent requests.

num_concurrent_requests_during_catchup.description:
During catchup, the node will use a different number of concurrent requests
to reduce the performance impact of state sync.

ExternalStorageLocation.description: Supported external storage backends and their minimal config.

region.description: Data may only be available in certain locations.

oneOf.description: Local filesystem root for storing data.
oneOf.title: Filesystem

oneOf.description: Google Cloud Storage bucket name.
oneOf.title: GCS

ExternalStorageLocation.title: ExternalStorageLocation

Fee.description:
Costs associated with an object that can only be sent over the network (and executed
by the receiver).
NOTE: `send_sir` or `send_not_sir` fees are usually burned when the item is being created.
And `execution` fee is burned when the item is being executed.

send_not_sir.description: Fee for sending an object potentially across the shards.

send_sir.description:
Fee for sending an object from the sender to itself, guaranteeing that it does not leave
the shard.

Fee.title: Fee

FinalExecutionOutcomeView.description:
Execution outcome of the transaction and all the subsequent receipts.
Could be not finalized yet

status.description:
Execution status defined by chain.rs:get_final_transaction_result
FinalExecutionStatus::NotStarted - the tx is not converted to the receipt yet
FinalExecutionStatus::Started - we have at least 1 receipt, but the first leaf receipt_id (using dfs) hasn't finished the execution
FinalExecutionStatus::Failure - the result of the first leaf receipt_id
FinalExecutionStatus::SuccessValue - the result of the first leaf receipt_id

transaction_outcome.description: The execution outcome of the signed transaction.

FinalExecutionOutcomeView.title: FinalExecutionOutcomeView

FinalExecutionOutcomeWithReceiptView.description:
Final execution outcome of the transaction and all of subsequent the receipts. Also includes
the generated receipt.

status.description:
Execution status defined by chain.rs:get_final_transaction_result
FinalExecutionStatus::NotStarted - the tx is not converted to the receipt yet
FinalExecutionStatus::Started - we have at least 1 receipt, but the first leaf receipt_id (using dfs) hasn't finished the execution
FinalExecutionStatus::Failure - the result of the first leaf receipt_id
FinalExecutionStatus::SuccessValue - the result of the first leaf receipt_id

transaction_outcome.description: The execution outcome of the signed transaction.

FinalExecutionOutcomeWithReceiptView.title: FinalExecutionOutcomeWithReceiptView

oneOf.description: The execution has not yet started.
The execution has started and still going.
The execution has failed with the given error.
oneOf.title: Failure

oneOf.description: The execution has succeeded and returned some value or an empty vec encoded in base64.
oneOf.title: SuccessValue

FunctionArgs.description:
This type is used to mark function arguments.

NOTE: The main reason for this to exist (except the type-safety) is that the value is
transparently serialized and deserialized as a base64-encoded string when serde is used
(serde_json).
FunctionArgs.title: FunctionArgs

FunctionCallError.description:
Serializable version of `near-vm-runner::FunctionCallError`.

Must never reorder/remove elements, can only add new variants at the end (but do that very
carefully). It describes stable serialization format, and only used by serialization logic.

oneOf.description: Wasm compilation error
oneOf.title: CompilationError

oneOf.description:
Wasm binary env link error

Note: this is only to deserialize old data, use execution error for new data
oneOf.title: LinkError

oneOf.description: Import/export resolve error
oneOf.title: MethodResolveError

oneOf.description:
A trap happened during execution of a binary

Note: this is only to deserialize old data, use execution error for new data
oneOf.title: WasmTrap

oneOf.description: Note: this is only to deserialize old data, use execution error for new data
oneOf.title: HostError

FunctionCallError.title: FunctionCallError

FunctionCallPermission.description:
Grants limited permission to make transactions with FunctionCallActions
The permission can limit the allowed balance to be spent on the prepaid gas.
It also restrict the account ID of the receiver for this function call.
It also can restrict the method name for the allowed function calls.

allowance.description:
Allowance is a balance limit to use by this access key to pay for function call gas and
transaction fees. When this access key is used, both account balance and the allowance is
decreased by the same value.
`None` means unlimited allowance.
NOTE: To change or increase the allowance, the old access key needs to be deleted and a new
access key should be created.

method_names.description:
A list of method names that can be used. The access key only allows transactions with the
function call of one of the given method names.
Empty list means any method name can be used.

receiver_id.description: The access key only allows transactions with the given receiver's account id.

FunctionCallPermission.title: FunctionCallPermission

gc_blocks_limit.description:
Maximum number of blocks to garbage collect at every garbage collection
call.

gc_fork_clean_step.description:
Maximum number of height to go through at each garbage collection step
when cleaning forks during garbage collection.

gc_num_epochs_to_keep.description: Number of epochs for which we keep store data.

gc_step_period.description: How often gc should be run

avg_hidden_validator_seats_per_shard.description: Expected number of hidden validators per shard.

block_producer_kickout_threshold.description: Threshold for kicking out block producers, between 0 and 100.

chain_id.description:
ID of the blockchain. This must be unique for every blockchain.
If your testnet blockchains do not have unique chain IDs, you will have a bad time.

chunk_producer_assignment_changes_limit.description:
Limits the number of shard changes in chunk producer assignments,
if algorithm is able to choose assignment with better balance of
number of chunk producers for shards.

chunk_producer_kickout_threshold.description: Threshold for kicking out chunk producers, between 0 and 100.

chunk_validator_only_kickout_threshold.description: Threshold for kicking out nodes which are only chunk validators, between 0 and 100.

epoch_length.description: Epoch length counted in block heights.

max_inflation_rate.description: Maximum inflation on the total supply every epoch.

max_kickout_stake_perc.description: Max stake percentage of the validators we will kick out.

min_gas_price.description: Minimum gas price. It is also the initial gas price.

minimum_stake_divisor.description: The minimum stake required for staking is last seat price divided by this number.

minimum_stake_ratio.description:
The lowest ratio s/s_total any block producer can have.
See <https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/167> for details

minimum_validators_per_shard.description: The minimum number of validators each shard must have

num_block_producer_seats.description: Number of block producer seats at genesis.

num_block_producer_seats_per_shard.description:
Defines number of shards and number of block producer seats per each shard at genesis.
Note: not used with protocol_feature_chunk_only_producers -- replaced by minimum_validators_per_shard
Note: not used before as all block producers produce chunks for all shards

num_blocks_per_year.description: Expected number of blocks per year

num_chunk_producer_seats.description:
Number of chunk producers.
Don't mess it up with chunk-only producers feature which is deprecated.

online_max_threshold.description: Online maximum threshold above which validator gets full reward.

online_min_threshold.description: Online minimum threshold below which validator doesn't receive reward.

protocol_upgrade_stake_threshold.description: Threshold of stake that needs to indicate that they ready for upgrade.

protocol_version.description: Protocol version that this genesis works with.

shard_layout.description: Layout information regarding how to split accounts to shards

shuffle_shard_assignment_for_chunk_produ.description:
If true, shuffle the chunk producers across shards. In other words, if
the shard assignments were `[S_0, S_1, S_2, S_3]` where `S_i` represents
the set of chunk producers for shard `i`, if this flag were true, the
shard assignments might become, for example, `[S_2, S_0, S_3, S_1]`.

target_validator_mandates_per_shard.description: Number of target chunk validator mandates for each shard.

total_supply.description: Total supply of tokens at genesis.

transaction_validity_period.description: Number of blocks for which a given transaction is valid

use_production_config.description:
This is only for test purposes. We hard code some configs for mainnet and testnet
in AllEpochConfig, and we want to have a way to test that code path. This flag is for that.
If set to true, the node will use the same config override path as mainnet and testnet.

oneOf.description:
Contract is deployed under its code hash.
Users will be able reference it by that hash.
This effectively makes the contract immutable.

Contract is deployed under the owner account id.
Users will be able reference it by that account id.
This allows the owner to update the contract for all its users.
String encoding is bad UTF-16 sequence
String encoding is bad UTF-8 sequence
Exceeded the prepaid gas
Exceeded the maximum amount of gas allowed to burn per contract
Exceeded the account balance
Tried to call an empty method name
Smart contract panicked
oneOf.title: GuestPanic

oneOf.description: IntegerOverflow happened during a contract execution
`promise_idx` does not correspond to existing promises
oneOf.title: InvalidPromiseIndex

oneOf.description: Actions can only be appended to non-joint promise.
Returning joint promise is currently prohibited
Accessed invalid promise result index
oneOf.title: InvalidPromiseResultIndex

oneOf.description: Accessed invalid register id
oneOf.title: InvalidRegisterId

oneOf.description: Iterator `iterator_index` was invalidated after its creation by performing a mutable operation on trie
oneOf.title: IteratorWasInvalidated

oneOf.description: Accessed memory outside the bounds
VM Logic returned an invalid receipt index
oneOf.title: InvalidReceiptIndex

oneOf.description: Iterator index `iterator_index` does not exist
oneOf.title: InvalidIteratorIndex

oneOf.description: VM Logic returned an invalid account id
VM Logic returned an invalid method name
VM Logic provided an invalid public key
`method_name` is not allowed in view calls
oneOf.title: ProhibitedInView

oneOf.description: The total number of logs will exceed the limit.
oneOf.title: NumberOfLogsExceeded

oneOf.description: The storage key length exceeded the limit.
oneOf.title: KeyLengthExceeded

oneOf.description: The storage value length exceeded the limit.
oneOf.title: ValueLengthExceeded

oneOf.description: The total log length exceeded the limit.
oneOf.title: TotalLogLengthExceeded

oneOf.description: The maximum number of promises within a FunctionCall exceeded the limit.
oneOf.title: NumberPromisesExceeded

oneOf.description: The maximum number of input data dependencies exceeded the limit.
oneOf.title: NumberInputDataDependenciesExceeded

oneOf.description: The returned value length exceeded the limit.
oneOf.title: ReturnedValueLengthExceeded

oneOf.description: The contract size for DeployContract action exceeded the limit.
oneOf.title: ContractSizeExceeded

oneOf.description: The host function was deprecated.
oneOf.title: Deprecated

oneOf.description: General errors for ECDSA recover.
oneOf.title: ECRecoverError

oneOf.description:
Invalid input to alt_bn128 family of functions (e.g., point which isn't
on the curve).
oneOf.title: AltBn128InvalidInput

oneOf.description:
Invalid input to ed25519 signature verification function (e.g. signature cannot be
derived from bytes).
oneOf.title: Ed25519VerifyInvalidInput

oneOf.description: The access key identified by the `public_key` doesn't exist for the account
oneOf.title: AccessKeyNotFound

oneOf.description: Transaction `receiver_id` doesn't match the access key receiver_id
oneOf.title: ReceiverMismatch

oneOf.description: Transaction method name isn't allowed by the access key
oneOf.title: MethodNameMismatch

oneOf.description: Transaction requires a full permission access key.
Access Key does not have enough allowance to cover transaction cost
oneOf.title: NotEnoughAllowance

oneOf.description: Having a deposit with a function call action is not allowed with a function call access key.

InvalidTxError.description: An error happened during TX execution

oneOf.description: Happens if a wrong AccessKey used or AccessKey has not enough permissions
oneOf.title: InvalidAccessKeyError

oneOf.description: TX signer_id is not a valid [`AccountId`]
oneOf.title: InvalidSignerId

oneOf.description: TX signer_id is not found in a storage
oneOf.title: SignerDoesNotExist

oneOf.description: Transaction nonce must be strictly greater than `account[access_key].nonce`.
oneOf.title: InvalidNonce

oneOf.description: Transaction nonce is larger than the upper bound given by the block height
oneOf.title: NonceTooLarge

oneOf.description: TX receiver_id is not a valid AccountId
oneOf.title: InvalidReceiverId

oneOf.description: TX signature is not valid
Account does not have enough balance to cover TX cost
oneOf.title: NotEnoughBalance

oneOf.description: Signer account doesn't have enough balance after transaction.

amount.description: Required balance to cover the state.

signer_id.description: An account which doesn't have enough balance to cover storage.

oneOf.title: LackBalanceForState

oneOf.description: An integer overflow occurred during transaction cost estimation.
Transaction parent block hash doesn't belong to the current chain
Transaction has expired
An error occurred while validating actions of a Transaction.
oneOf.title: ActionsValidation

oneOf.description: The size of serialized transaction exceeded the limit.
oneOf.title: TransactionSizeExceeded

oneOf.description: Transaction version is invalid.

The receiver shard of the transaction is too congested to accept new
transactions at the moment.

congestion_level.description: A value between 0 (no congestion) and 1 (max congestion).

oneOf.title: ShardCongested

oneOf.description:
The receiver shard of the transaction missed several chunks and rejects
new transaction until it can make progress again.

missed_chunks.description: The number of blocks since the last included chunk of the shard.

shard_id.description: The shard that fails making progress.

oneOf.title: ShardStuck

oneOf.description:
Transaction is specifying an invalid nonce index. Gas key transactions
must have a nonce_index in valid range, regular transactions must not.

num_nonces.description: Number of nonces supported by the key. 0 means no nonce_index allowed (regular key).

tx_nonce_index.description: The nonce_index from the transaction (None if missing).

oneOf.title: InvalidNonceIndex

oneOf.description: Gas key does not have enough balance to cover gas costs.
oneOf.title: NotEnoughGasKeyBalance

oneOf.description:
Gas key transaction failed because the account could not cover the deposit cost.
Gas is still charged from the gas key in this case.
oneOf.title: NotEnoughBalanceForDeposit

InvalidTxError.title: InvalidTxError

KnownProducerView.description:
Information about a Producer: its account name, peer_id and a list of connected peers that
the node can use to send message for this producer.
KnownProducerView.title: KnownProducerView

LimitConfig.description:
Describes limits for VM and Runtime.
TODO #4139: consider switching to strongly-typed wrappers instead of raw quantities

account_id_validity_rules_version.description:
Whether to enforce account_id well-formed-ness where it wasn't enforced
historically.

initial_memory_pages.description:
The initial number of memory pages.
NOTE: It's not a limiter itself, but it's a value we use for initial_memory_pages.

max_actions_per_receipt.description: Max number of actions per receipt.

max_arguments_length.description: Max length of arguments in a function call action.

max_elements_per_contract_table.description: If present, stores max number of elements in a single contract's table

max_functions_number_per_contract.description: If present, stores max number of functions in one contract

max_gas_burnt.description: Max amount of gas that can be used, excluding gas attached to promises.

max_length_method_name.description: Max length of any method name (without terminating character).

max_locals_per_contract.description: If present, stores max number of locals declared globally in one contract

max_memory_pages.description: What is the maximal memory pages amount is allowed to have for a contract.

max_number_bytes_method_names.description:
Max total length of all method names (including terminating character) for a function call
permission access key.

max_number_input_data_dependencies.description: Max number of input data dependencies

max_number_registers.description:
Maximum number of registers that can be used simultaneously.

Note that due to an implementation quirk [read: a bug] in VMLogic, if we
have this number of registers, no subsequent writes to the registers
will succeed even if they replace an existing register.

max_promises_per_function_call_action.description: Max number of promises that a function call can create

max_register_size.description: Maximum number of bytes that can be stored in a single register.

max_stack_height.description:
How tall the stack is allowed to grow?

See <https://wiki.parity.io/WebAssembly-StackHeight> to find out how the stack frame cost
is calculated.

max_tables_per_contract.description: If present, stores max number of tables declared globally in one contract

max_total_log_length.description: Maximum total length in bytes of all log messages.

max_total_prepaid_gas.description: Max total prepaid gas for all function call actions per receipt.

max_yield_payload_size.description: Maximum number of bytes for payload passed over a yield resume.

per_receipt_storage_proof_size_limit.description: Hard limit on the size of storage proof generated while executing a single receipt.

registers_memory_limit.description: Limit of memory used by registers.

yield_timeout_length_in_blocks.description: Number of blocks after which a yielded promise times out.

LimitConfig.title: LimitConfig

MissingTrieValueContext.description: Contexts in which `StorageError::MissingTrieValue` error might occur.

oneOf.description: Missing trie value when reading from TrieIterator.
Missing trie value when reading from TriePrefetchingStorage.
Missing trie value when reading from TrieMemoryPartialStorage.
Missing trie value when reading from TrieStorage.

MissingTrieValueContext.title: MissingTrieValueContext

NonDelegateAction.description: An Action that can be included in a transaction or receipt, excluding delegate actions. This type represents all possible action types except DelegateAction to prevent infinite recursion in meta-transactions.

oneOf.description:
Create an (sub)account using a transaction `receiver_id` as an ID for
a new account ID must pass validation rules described here
<https://nomicon.io/DataStructures/Account>.
oneOf.title: CreateAccount

oneOf.description: Sets a Wasm code to a receiver_id
oneOf.title: DeployContract

NonDelegateAction.title: NonDelegateAction

PeerId.description: Peer id is the public key.
PeerId.title: PeerId

PrepareError.description: Error that can occur while preparing or executing Wasm smart-contract.

oneOf.description: Error happened while serializing the module.
Error happened while deserializing the module.
Internal memory declaration has been found in the module.

Gas instrumentation failed.

This most likely indicates the module isn't valid.

Stack instrumentation failed.

This  most likely indicates the module isn't valid.

Error happened during instantiation.

This might indicate that `start` function trapped, or module isn't
instantiable and/or un-linkable.
Error creating memory.
Contract contains too many functions.
Contract contains too many locals.
Contract contains too many tables.
Contract contains too many table elements.

PrepareError.title: PrepareError

ProtocolVersionCheckConfig.description: Configures whether the node checks the next or the next next epoch for network version compatibility.
ProtocolVersionCheckConfig.title: ProtocolVersionCheckConfig

ReceiptValidationError.description: Describes the error for validating a receipt.

oneOf.description: The `predecessor_id` of a Receipt is not valid.
oneOf.title: InvalidPredecessorId

oneOf.description: The `receiver_id` of a Receipt is not valid.
oneOf.title: InvalidReceiverId

oneOf.description: The `signer_id` of an ActionReceipt is not valid.
oneOf.title: InvalidSignerId

oneOf.description: The `receiver_id` of a DataReceiver within an ActionReceipt is not valid.
oneOf.title: InvalidDataReceiverId

oneOf.description: The length of the returned data exceeded the limit in a DataReceipt.
oneOf.title: ReturnedValueLengthExceeded

oneOf.description: The number of input data dependencies exceeds the limit in an ActionReceipt.
oneOf.title: NumberInputDataDependenciesExceeded

oneOf.description: An error occurred while validating actions of an ActionReceipt.
oneOf.title: ActionsValidation

oneOf.description: Receipt is bigger than the limit.
oneOf.title: ReceiptSizeExceeded

oneOf.description: The `refund_to` of an ActionReceipt is not valid.
oneOf.title: InvalidRefundTo

ReceiptValidationError.title: ReceiptValidationError

author.description: The AccountId of the author of the Block

RpcClientConfigResponse.description: ClientConfig where some fields can be updated at runtime.

archive.description: Not clear old data, set `true` for archive nodes.

block_fetch_horizon.description: Horizon at which instead of fetching block, fetch full state.

block_header_fetch_horizon.description: Behind this horizon header fetch kicks in.

block_production_tracking_delay.description: Duration to check for producing / skipping block.

catchup_step_period.description: Time between check to perform catchup.

chunk_distribution_network.description:
Optional config for the Chunk Distribution Network feature.
If set to `None` then this node does not participate in the Chunk Distribution Network.
Nodes not participating will still function fine, but possibly with higher
latency due to the need of requesting chunks over the peer-to-peer network.

chunk_request_retry_period.description: Time between checking to re-request chunks.

chunk_validation_threads.description: Number of threads for ChunkValidationActor pool.

chunk_wait_mult.description: Multiplier for the wait time for all chunks to be received.

chunks_cache_height_horizon.description:
Height horizon for the chunk cache. A chunk is removed from the cache
if its height + chunks_cache_height_horizon < largest_seen_height.
The default value is DEFAULT_CHUNKS_CACHE_HEIGHT_HORIZON.

client_background_migration_threads.description: Number of threads to execute background migration work in client.

cloud_archival_writer.description:
Configuration for a cloud-based archival writer. If this config is present, the writer is enabled and
writes chunk-related data based on the tracked shards.

disable_tx_routing.description: If true, the node won't forward transactions to next the chunk producers.

enable_early_prepare_transactions.description:
If true, transactions for the next chunk will be prepared early, right after the previous chunk's
post-state is ready. This can help produce chunks faster, for high-throughput chains.
The current implementation increases latency on low-load chains, which will be fixed in the future.
The default is disabled.

enable_statistics_export.description: Re-export storage layer statistics as prometheus metrics.

expected_shutdown.description: Graceful shutdown at expected block height.

header_sync_expected_height_per_second.description: Expected increase of header head height per second during header sync

header_sync_initial_timeout.description: How much time to wait after initial header sync

header_sync_progress_timeout.description: How much time to wait after some progress is made in header sync

header_sync_stall_ban_timeout.description: How much time to wait before banning a peer in header sync if sync is too slow

max_block_production_delay.description: Maximum wait for approvals before producing block.

max_block_wait_delay.description: Maximum duration before skipping given height.

max_gas_burnt_view.description:
Max burnt gas per view method.  If present, overrides value stored in
genesis file.  The value only affects the RPCs without influencing the
protocol thus changing it per-node doesn’t affect the blockchain.

min_num_peers.description: Minimum number of peers to start syncing.

orphan_state_witness_max_size.description:
Maximum size of state witnesses in the OrphanStateWitnessPool.

We keep only orphan witnesses which are smaller than this size.
This limits the maximum memory usage of OrphanStateWitnessPool.

orphan_state_witness_pool_size.description:
OrphanStateWitnessPool keeps instances of ChunkStateWitness which can't be processed
because the previous block isn't available. The witnesses wait in the pool until the
required block appears. This variable controls how many witnesses can be stored in the pool.

produce_chunk_add_transactions_time_limi.description:
Limit the time of adding transactions to a chunk.
A node produces a chunk by adding transactions from the transaction pool until
some limit is reached. This time limit ensures that adding transactions won't take
longer than the specified duration, which helps to produce the chunk quickly.

produce_empty_blocks.description: Produce empty blocks, use `false` for testing.

protocol_version_check.description:
Determines whether client should exit if the protocol version is not supported
for the next or next next epoch.

save_invalid_witnesses.description:
Save observed instances of invalid ChunkStateWitness to the database in DBCol::InvalidChunkStateWitnesses.
Saving invalid witnesses is useful for analysis and debugging.
This option can cause extra load on the database and is not recommended for production use.

save_latest_witnesses.description:
Save observed instances of ChunkStateWitness to the database in DBCol::LatestChunkStateWitnesses.
Saving the latest witnesses is useful for analysis and debugging.
This option can cause extra load on the database and is not recommended for production use.

save_state_changes.description: Whether to persist state changes on disk or not.

save_trie_changes.description:
save_trie_changes should be set to true iff
- archive if false - non-archival nodes need trie changes to perform garbage collection
- archive is true, cold_store is configured and migration to split_storage is finished - node
working in split storage mode needs trie changes in order to do garbage collection on hot.

save_tx_outcomes.description: Whether to persist transaction outcomes to disk or not.

save_untracked_partial_chunks_parts.description: Whether to persist partial chunk parts for untracked shards or not.

skip_sync_wait.description: Skip waiting for sync (for testing or single node testnet).

state_request_server_threads.description: Number of threads for StateRequestActor pool.

state_request_throttle_period.description:
Number of seconds between state requests for view client.
Throttling window for state requests (headers and parts).

state_requests_per_throttle_period.description: Maximum number of state requests served per throttle period

state_sync_enabled.description:
Whether to use the State Sync mechanism.
If disabled, the node will do Block Sync instead of State Sync.

state_sync_external_backoff.description: Additional waiting period after a failed request to external storage

state_sync_external_timeout.description: How long to wait for a response from centralized state sync

state_sync_p2p_timeout.description: How long to wait for a response from p2p state sync

state_sync_retry_backoff.description: How long to wait after a failed state sync request

sync_check_period.description: How often to check that we are not out of sync.

sync_height_threshold.description: Sync height threshold: below this difference in height don't start syncing.

sync_max_block_requests.description: Maximum number of block requests to send to peers to sync

sync_step_period.description: While syncing, how long to check for each step.

transaction_pool_size_limit.description:
Limit of the size of per-shard transaction pool measured in bytes. If not set, the size
will be unbounded.

trie_viewer_state_size_limit.description: Upper bound of the byte size of contract state that is still viewable. None is no limit

ttl_account_id_router.description: Time to persist Accounts Id in the router without removing them.

tx_routing_height_horizon.description:
If the node is not a chunk producer within that many blocks, then route
to upcoming chunk producers.

view_client_threads.description: Number of threads for ViewClientActor pool.

RpcClientConfigResponse.title: RpcClientConfigResponse

RpcLightClientNextBlockResponse.description: A state for the current head of a light client. More info [here](https://nomicon.io/ChainSpec/LightClient).

inner_lite.description:
Inner part of the block header that gets hashed, split into two parts, one that is sent
   to light clients, and the rest

RpcLightClientNextBlockResponse.title: RpcLightClientNextBlockResponse

known_producers.description: Accounts of known block and chunk producers from routing table.

avg_hidden_validator_seats_per_shard.description: Expected number of hidden validators per shard.

block_producer_kickout_threshold.description: Threshold for kicking out block producers, between 0 and 100.

chain_id.description:
ID of the blockchain. This must be unique for every blockchain.
If your testnet blockchains do not have unique chain IDs, you will have a bad time.

chunk_producer_kickout_threshold.description: Threshold for kicking out chunk producers, between 0 and 100.

chunk_validator_only_kickout_threshold.description: Threshold for kicking out nodes which are only chunk validators, between 0 and 100.

epoch_length.description: Epoch length counted in block heights.

max_inflation_rate.description: Maximum inflation on the total supply every epoch.

max_kickout_stake_perc.description: Max stake percentage of the validators we will kick out.

min_gas_price.description: Minimum gas price. It is also the initial gas price.

minimum_stake_divisor.description: The minimum stake required for staking is last seat price divided by this number.

minimum_stake_ratio.description:
The lowest ratio s/s_total any block producer can have.
See <https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/167> for details

minimum_validators_per_shard.description: The minimum number of validators each shard must have

num_block_producer_seats.description: Number of block producer seats at genesis.

num_block_producer_seats_per_shard.description: Defines number of shards and number of block producer seats per each shard at genesis.

num_blocks_per_year.description: Expected number of blocks per year

online_max_threshold.description: Online maximum threshold above which validator gets full reward.

online_min_threshold.description: Online minimum threshold below which validator doesn't receive reward.

protocol_upgrade_stake_threshold.description: Threshold of stake that needs to indicate that they ready for upgrade.

shard_layout.description: Layout information regarding how to split accounts to shards

shuffle_shard_assignment_for_chunk_produ.description:
If true, shuffle the chunk producers across shards. In other words, if
the shard assignments were `[S_0, S_1, S_2, S_3]` where `S_i` represents
the set of chunk producers for shard `i`, if this flag were true, the
shard assignments might become, for example, `[S_2, S_0, S_3, S_1]`.

target_validator_mandates_per_shard.description: Number of target chunk validator mandates for each shard.

transaction_validity_period.description: Number of blocks for which a given transaction is valid

RpcStateChangesInBlockByTypeRequest.description:
It is a [serializable view] of [`StateChangesRequest`].

[serializable view]: ./index.html
[`StateChangesRequest`]: ../types/struct.StateChangesRequest.html
RpcStateChangesInBlockByTypeRequest.title: RpcStateChangesInBlockByTypeRequest

detailed_debug_status.description: Information about last blocks, network, epoch and chain & chunk info.

latest_protocol_version.description: Latest protocol version that this client supports.

node_key.description: Deprecated; same as `validator_public_key` which you should use instead.

rpc_addr.description: Address for RPC server.  None if node doesn't have RPC endpoint enabled.

RpcValidatorResponse.description: Information about this epoch validators and next epoch validators
RpcValidatorResponse.title: RpcValidatorResponse

RuntimeConfigView.description: View that preserves JSON format of the runtime config.

account_creation_config.description: Config that defines rules for account creation.

storage_amount_per_byte.description:
Amount of yN per byte required to have on the account.  See
<https://nomicon.io/Economics/Economics.html#state-stake> for details.

transaction_costs.description:
Costs of different actions that need to be performed when sending and
processing transaction and receipts.

RuntimeConfigView.title: RuntimeConfigView

RuntimeFeesConfigView.description: Describes different fees for the runtime

action_creation_config.description: Describes the cost of creating a certain action, `Action`. Includes all variants.

action_receipt_creation_config.description:
Describes the cost of creating an action receipt, `ActionReceipt`, excluding the actual cost
of actions.
- `send` cost is burned when a receipt is created using `promise_create` or
    `promise_batch_create`
- `exec` cost is burned when the receipt is being executed.

burnt_gas_reward.description: Fraction of the burnt gas to reward to the contract account for execution.

data_receipt_creation_config.description: Describes the cost of creating a data receipt, `DataReceipt`.

RuntimeFeesConfigView.title: RuntimeFeesConfigView

ShardId.description:
The shard identifier. It may be an arbitrary number - it does not need to be
a number in the range 0..NUM_SHARDS. The shard ids do not need to be
sequential or contiguous.

The shard id is wrapped in a new type to prevent the old pattern of using
indices in range 0..NUM_SHARDS and casting to ShardId. Once the transition
if fully complete it potentially may be simplified to a regular type alias.
ShardId.title: ShardId

ShardLayout.description:
A versioned struct that contains all information needed to assign accounts to shards.

Because of re-sharding, the chain may use different shard layout to split shards at different
times. Currently, `ShardLayout` is stored as part of `EpochConfig`, which is generated each
epoch given the epoch protocol version. In mainnet/testnet, we use two shard layouts since
re-sharding has only happened once. It is stored as part of genesis config, see
default_simple_nightshade_shard_layout() Below is an overview for some important
functionalities of ShardLayout interface.
ShardLayout.title: ShardLayout

ShardLayoutV0.description:
A shard layout that maps accounts evenly across all shards -- by calculate the hash of account
id and mod number of shards. This is added to capture the old `account_id_to_shard_id` algorithm,
to keep backward compatibility for some existing tests.
`parent_shards` for `ShardLayoutV1` is always `None`, meaning it can only be the first shard layout
a chain uses.

num_shards.description: Map accounts evenly across all shards

version.description: Version of the shard layout, this is useful for uniquely identify the shard layout

ShardLayoutV0.title: ShardLayoutV0

boundary_accounts.description:
The boundary accounts are the accounts on boundaries between shards.
Each shard contains a range of accounts from one boundary account to
another - or the smallest or largest account possible. The total
number of shards is equal to the number of boundary accounts plus 1.

shards_split_map.description:
Maps shards from the last shard layout to shards that it splits to in this shard layout,
Useful for constructing states for the shards.
None for the genesis shard layout

to_parent_shard_map.description:
Maps shard in this shard layout to their parent shard
Since shard_ids always range from 0 to num_shards - 1, we use vec instead of a hashmap

version.description: Version of the shard layout, this is useful for uniquely identify the shard layout

ShardLayoutV2.description:
Counterpart to `ShardLayoutV2` composed of maps with string keys to aid
serde serialization.
ShardLayoutV2.title: ShardLayoutV2

ShardLayoutV3.description:
Counterpart to `ShardLayoutV3` composed of maps with string keys to aid
serde serialization.
ShardLayoutV3.title: ShardLayoutV3

ShardUId.description:
`ShardUId` is a unique representation for shards from different shard layouts.

Comparing to `ShardId`, which is just an ordinal number ranging from 0 to NUM_SHARDS-1,
`ShardUId` provides a way to unique identify shards when shard layouts may change across epochs.
This is important because we store states indexed by shards in our database, so we need a
way to unique identify shard even when shards change across epochs.
Another difference between `ShardUId` and `ShardId` is that `ShardUId` should only exist in
a node's internal state while `ShardId` can be exposed to outside APIs and used in protocol
level information (for example, `ShardChunkHeader` contains `ShardId` instead of `ShardUId`)
ShardUId.title: ShardUId

StakeAction.description: An action which stakes signer_id tokens and setup's validator public key

public_key.description: Validator key which will be used to sign transactions on behalf of signer_id

StakeAction.title: StakeAction

StateChangeKindView.description:
It is a [serializable view] of [`StateChangeKind`].

[serializable view]: ./index.html
[`StateChangeKind`]: ../types/struct.StateChangeKind.html
StateChangeKindView.title: StateChangeKindView

StateItem.description: Item of the state, key and value are serialized in base64 and proof for inclusion of given state item.
StateItem.title: StateItem

dump.description: `none` value disables state dump to external storage.

parts_compression_lvl.description: Zstd compression level for state parts.

StorageError.description:
Errors which may occur during working with trie storages, storing
trie values (trie nodes and state values) by their hashes.

oneOf.description: Key-value db internal failure
Requested trie value by its hash which is missing in storage.
oneOf.title: MissingTrieValue

oneOf.description:
Found trie node which shouldn't be part of state. Raised during
validation of state sync parts where incorrect node was passed.
TODO (#8997): consider including hash of trie node.

Either invalid state or key-value db is corrupted.
For PartialStorage it cannot be corrupted.
Error message is unreliable and for debugging purposes only. It's also probably ok to
panic in every place that produces this error.
We can check if db is corrupted by verifying everything in the state trie.
oneOf.title: StorageInconsistentState

oneOf.description:
Flat storage error, meaning that it doesn't support some block anymore.
We guarantee that such block cannot become final, thus block processing
must resume normally.
oneOf.title: FlatStorageBlockNotSupported

oneOf.description: In-memory trie could not be loaded for some reason.
oneOf.title: MemTrieLoadingError

StorageError.title: StorageError

StorageGetMode.description: This enum represents if a storage_get call will be performed through flat storage or trie
StorageGetMode.title: StorageGetMode

StorageUsageConfigView.description: Describes cost of storage per block

num_bytes_account.description: Number of bytes for an account record, including rounding up for account id.

num_extra_bytes_record.description: Additional number of bytes for a k/v record

StorageUsageConfigView.title: StorageUsageConfigView

StoreKey.description:
This type is used to mark keys (arrays of bytes) that are queried from store.

NOTE: Currently, this type is only used in the view_client and RPC to be able to transparently
pretty-serialize the bytes arrays as base64-encoded strings (see `serialize.rs`).
StoreKey.title: StoreKey

StoreValue.description:
This type is used to mark values returned from store (arrays of bytes).

NOTE: Currently, this type is only used in the view_client and RPC to be able to transparently
pretty-serialize the bytes arrays as base64-encoded strings (see `serialize.rs`).
StoreValue.title: StoreValue

apply.description:
Maximum number of "apply parts" tasks that can be performed in parallel.
This is a very disk-heavy task and therefore we set this to a low limit,
or else the rocksdb contention makes the whole server freeze up.

apply_during_catchup.description:
Maximum number of "apply parts" tasks that can be performed in parallel
during catchup. We set this to a very low value to avoid overloading the
node while it is still performing normal tasks.

peer_downloads.description: Maximum number of outstanding requests for decentralized state sync.

per_shard.description:
The maximum parallelism to use per shard. This is mostly for fairness, because
the actual rate limiting is done by the TaskTrackers, but this is useful for
balancing the shards a little.

SyncConfig.description: Configures how to fetch state parts during state sync.

oneOf.description: Syncs state from the peers without reading anything from external storage.

Expects parts to be available in external storage.

Usually as a fallback after some number of attempts to use peers.
oneOf.title: ExternalStorage

SyncConfig.title: SyncConfig

TrackedShardsConfig.description:
Describes the expected behavior of the node regarding shard tracking.
If the node is an active validator, it will also track the shards it is responsible for as a validator.

oneOf.description: Tracks no shards (light client).
Tracks arbitrary shards.
oneOf.title: Shards

oneOf.description: Tracks all shards.
Tracks shards that are assigned to given validator account.
oneOf.title: ShadowValidator

oneOf.description:
Rotate between these sets of tracked shards.
Used to simulate the behavior of chunk only producers without staking tokens.
oneOf.title: Schedule

oneOf.description: Tracks shards that contain one of the given account.
oneOf.title: Accounts

TrackedShardsConfig.title: TrackedShardsConfig

TransferToGasKeyAction.description: Transfer NEAR to a gas key's balance

deposit.description: Amount of NEAR to transfer to the gas key

public_key.description: The public key of the gas key to fund

TransferToGasKeyAction.title: TransferToGasKeyAction

TrieSplit.description:
The result of splitting a memtrie into two possibly even parts, according to `memory_usage`
stored in the trie nodes.

**NOTE: This is an artificial value calculated according to `TRIE_COST`. Hence, it does not
represent actual memory allocation, but the split ratio should be roughly consistent with that.**

boundary_account.description: Account ID representing the split path

left_memory.description: Total `memory_usage` of the left part (excluding the split path)

right_memory.description: Total `memory_usage` of the right part (including the split path)

TrieSplit.title: TrieSplit

TxExecutionError.description: Error returned in the ExecutionOutcome in case of failure

oneOf.description: An error happened during Action execution
oneOf.title: ActionError

oneOf.description: An error happened during Transaction execution
oneOf.title: InvalidTxError

TxExecutionError.title: TxExecutionError

oneOf.description: Transaction is waiting to be included into the block
Transaction is included into the block. The block may be not finalized yet

Transaction is included into the block +
All non-refund transaction receipts finished their execution.
The corresponding blocks for tx and each receipt may be not finalized yet
Transaction is included into finalized block

Transaction is included into finalized block +
All non-refund transaction receipts finished their execution.
The corresponding blocks for each receipt may be not finalized yet

Transaction is included into finalized block +
Execution of all transaction receipts is finalized, including refund receipts

grow_mem_cost.description: Gas cost of a growing memory by single page.

limit_config.description:
Describes limits for VM and Runtime.

TODO: Consider changing this to `VMLimitConfigView` to avoid dependency
on runtime.

linear_op_base_cost.description: Base gas cost of a linear operation

linear_op_unit_cost.description: Unit gas cost of a linear operation

regular_op_cost.description: Gas cost of a regular operation.

oneOf.description: Wasmer 0.17.x VM. Gone now.
Wasmtime VM.
Wasmer 2.x VM.
NearVM.

ValidatorKickoutReason.description: Reasons for removing a validator from the validator set.

oneOf.description: Deprecated
Validator didn't produce enough blocks.
oneOf.title: NotEnoughBlocks

oneOf.description: Validator didn't produce enough chunks.
oneOf.title: NotEnoughChunks

oneOf.description: Validator unstaked themselves.
Validator stake is now below threshold
oneOf.title: NotEnoughStake

oneOf.description: Enough stake but is not chosen because of seat limits.
Validator didn't produce enough chunk endorsements.
oneOf.title: NotEnoughChunkEndorsements

oneOf.description:
Validator's last block proposal was for a protocol version older than
the network's voted protocol version.
oneOf.title: ProtocolVersionTooOld

ValidatorKickoutReason.title: ValidatorKickoutReason

Version.description: Data structure for semver version and github tag or commit.
Version.title: Version

ViewStateResult.description: Resulting state values for a view state query request
ViewStateResult.title: ViewStateResult

WasmTrap.description: A kind of a trap happened during execution of a binary

oneOf.description: An `unreachable` opcode was executed.
Call indirect incorrect signature trap.
Memory out of bounds trap.
Call indirect out of bounds trap.
An arithmetic exception, e.g. divided by zero.
Misaligned atomic access trap.
Indirect call to null.
Stack overflow.
Generic trap.

WasmTrap.title: WasmTrap

WithdrawFromGasKeyAction.description: Withdraw NEAR from a gas key's balance to the account

amount.description: Amount of NEAR to transfer from the gas key

public_key.description: The public key of the gas key to withdraw from

WithdrawFromGasKeyAction.title: WithdrawFromGasKeyAction

combined_transactions_size_limit.description:
Maximum size of transactions contained inside ChunkStateWitness.

A witness contains transactions from both the previous chunk and the current one.
This parameter limits the sum of sizes of transactions from both of those chunks.

main_storage_proof_size_soft_limit.description:
Size limit for storage proof generated while executing receipts in a chunk.
After this limit is reached we defer execution of any new receipts.

new_transactions_validation_state_size_s.description: Soft size limit of storage proof used to validate new transactions in ChunkStateWitness.

info.description: JSON-RPC API for interacting with the NEAR Protocol blockchain
info.title: NEAR Protocol JSON-RPC API

methods.name: block
methods.summary: Returns block details for given height or hash

methods.name: chunk
methods.summary: Returns details of a specific chunk

methods.name: gas_price
methods.summary: Returns gas price for a specific block_height or block_hash

methods.name: query
methods.summary: Query the blockchain state (view account, call function, etc.)

methods.name: send_tx
methods.summary: Sends a transaction and optionally waits for execution

methods.name: tx
methods.summary: Queries status of a transaction by hash

methods.name: status
methods.summary: Returns the status of the RPC node

methods.name: validators
methods.summary: Queries active validators on the network

methods.name: network_info
methods.summary: Queries the current state of node network connections

methods.name: health
methods.summary: Returns health status of the node

methods.name: light_client_proof
methods.summary: Returns execution proof for light clients

methods.name: next_light_client_block
methods.summary: Returns the next light client block

methods.name: light_client_block_proof
methods.summary: Returns block proof for light clients

methods.name: EXPERIMENTAL_changes_in_block
methods.summary: Returns changes in block for given block height or hash

methods.name: EXPERIMENTAL_changes
methods.summary: Returns state changes for specific state change kinds

methods.name: EXPERIMENTAL_protocol_config
methods.summary: Returns protocol configuration for given block

methods.name: EXPERIMENTAL_genesis_config
methods.summary: Returns genesis configuration of the network

methods.name: EXPERIMENTAL_receipt
methods.summary: Returns receipt by receipt_id

methods.name: EXPERIMENTAL_maintenance_windows
methods.summary: Returns maintenance windows for validators

methods.name: EXPERIMENTAL_split_storage_info
methods.summary: Returns split storage information

methods.name: EXPERIMENTAL_congestion_level
methods.summary: Returns congestion level for a chunk

methods.name: EXPERIMENTAL_validators_ordered
methods.summary: Returns validators ordered by stake for given epoch

methods.name: EXPERIMENTAL_client_config
methods.summary: Returns client configuration

methods.name: EXPERIMENTAL_tx_status
methods.summary: Queries status of a transaction by hash (alias for tx)

methods.name: EXPERIMENTAL_light_client_proof
methods.summary: Returns execution proof for light clients

methods.name: EXPERIMENTAL_light_client_block_proof
methods.summary: Returns block proof for light clients

methods.name: block_effects
methods.summary: Returns changes in block (alias for EXPERIMENTAL_changes_in_block)

methods.name: changes
methods.summary: Returns state changes (alias for EXPERIMENTAL_changes)

methods.name: genesis_config
methods.summary: Returns genesis configuration (alias for EXPERIMENTAL_genesis_config)

methods.name: client_config
methods.summary: Returns client configuration (alias for EXPERIMENTAL_client_config)

methods.name: maintenance_windows
methods.summary: Returns maintenance windows (alias for EXPERIMENTAL_maintenance_windows)

methods.name: broadcast_tx_async
methods.summary: Sends a transaction and immediately returns hash (deprecated: use send_tx)

methods.name: broadcast_tx_commit
